to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: I congratulate you on your good fortune-does that make me heartless?
sentences.chinese: 好福气，我给你道喜，你还怪我没有良心？

sentences.english: Let this poor monk be the first to congratulate this future official.
sentences.chinese: 让贫僧做第一个向将来高官道喜的人吧。

sentences.english: Well, ma 'am, now I am happy to congratulate you.
sentences.chinese: 呃，太太，我很高兴，现在我可以给您道喜啦。

sentences.english: I knew you would be wishing me joy.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你要预备来向我道喜了。

sentences.english: I'd like to be the first to congratulate you.
I give you joy, my dear niece.
sentences.chinese: 我向你道喜，亲爱的外甥女。

sentences.english: I'd heard she was pregnant so the first thing I did was congratulate her.
sentences.chinese: 之前听说她怀孕了，所以一见面我就向她道喜。

sentences.english: But I ought to have gone before. Not to wait upon a bride is very remiss.
sentences.chinese: 不过我早该去了，不去向新娘道喜总是不大妥当。

sentences.english: Friends and relatives came to congratulate the parents and to see the baby.
sentences.chinese: 朋友亲戚们都前来向父母道喜并看望婴儿。

sentences.english: Allow me to congratulate you before the happy event.

to announce good news/to report success
congratulate an elderly person on his birthday/offer birthday felicitations
